text: Cover of the Treaty The Treaty of Hamburg (German - Hamburger Vergleich or Hamburger Erbvergleich) was a dynastic house law of the House of Mecklenburg. Heavily influenced by representatives of the Lower Saxon Circle, it was agreed on 8 March 1701 in neutral Hamburg. It ended the dispute over the inheritance of the Mecklenburg-Güstrow caused by the death of Gustav Adolph, Duke of Mecklenburg-Güstrow without a male successor in 1695 and established the semi- ducal principalities of Mecklenburg-Strelitz and Mecklenburg-Schwerin. ==External links== *Reproduction of the Treaty of Hamburg (pdf) *Literature on the Treaty of Hamburg on the Landesbibliographie MV category:1701 treaties Category:History of Hamburg Hamburg Category:1701 in the Holy Roman Empire Category:1701 in Germany
title: Treaty of Hamburg (1701)
